basics.name: Lukas Mateju
basics.label: Industrial & Operations Engineering Student
basics.summary: Industrial & Operations Engineering student at the University of Michigan with interests in automation, robotics, product design, and process optimization. Experienced in both lab and industry settings, with a growing portfolio of technical and leadership projects.

work.name: Los Alamos National Laboratory
work.summary: Developed modular purification panel systems to improve radiochemical separations in hot cells. Integrated custom 3D-printed hardware and PLC automation for increased process reliability and operator safety.
highlights: Designed a modular panel for isotope workflows under strict spatial and radiation constraints
Created custom 3D-printed clips for scalable hardware mounting
Programmed PLC routines for fluid control, heating, and reagent automation

work.name: Swoboda Technologies Inc.
work.summary: Worked on designing and optimizing automated production lines for clients such as Tesla and GM.
highlights: Utilized CAD to model efficient manufacturing systems
Reduced downtime and improved productivity through data analysis and workflow streamlining

work.name: Robodawgs Elementary School Robotics Program
work.summary: Mentored elementary students in robotics and programming, preparing them for competitive events.
highlights: Developed lesson plans and hands-on activities in engineering and coding
Supported student teams in robot design and strategy

projects.name: Stumble â€“ Student Social Media Platform
projects.summary: Led development of a student-focused social media app using React, Next.js, and the UMich API. Managed team progress and directed feature planning from concept through deployment.
highlights: Front-end and back-end development using modern web frameworks
Deployed advanced chat and social media functionality

projects.name: Michigan Human Powered Submarine
projects.summary: Collaborated on building and outfitting a human-powered submarine for underwater competition. Focused on structural integrity and pilot ergonomics.
highlights: Participated in live testing and performance improvement

projects.name: Michigan Czech Student Association
projects.summary: Revitalized a cultural organization through event planning, outreach, and social engagement to support Czech students on campus.
highlights: Increased engagement through strategic event planning and digital outreach
Led coordination of cultural and language-focused programming
